body_html: Here is one approach for identifying what sort of operation you are looking at for a kOutput node: do a reverse post order traversal on the instructions in the fused computation. The first operation which is not a parameter is the operation of interest. In the case of reduce_window+divide, it would give you the reduce_window. In the case of convolution+add, it would give you the add.

In the case of convolution+add, it would give you the add.
body: Here is one approach for identifying what sort of operation you are looking at for a kOutput node: do a reverse post order traversal on the instructions in the fused computation. The first operation which is not a parameter is the operation of interest. In the case of reduce_window+divide, it would give you the reduce_window. In the case of convolution+add, it would give you the add.
